originalTitle: Robert Mugabe's son charged with attempted murder in South Africa
title: Robert Mugabe's son charged with attempted murder in South Africa
content: Bellarmine Mugabe and one other man have not commented on the charges after a 23-year-old was shot.

originalTitle: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
title: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
content: Sudan accuses Uganda of flouting international law by meeting Rapid Support Forces boss Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo.

originalTitle: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
title: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
content: Days of competition culminate in a fishing contest rooted in efforts to cement local peace.

originalTitle: Gaza child dies after Israel blocks medical evacuation
title: Gaza child dies after Israel blocks medical evacuation
content: Palestinian boy Nidal Abu Rabeea died in Gaza after waiting months for Israel to allow his medical evacuation.

originalTitle: ‘El Mencho’ killing sparks ‘overwhelming fear’ as violence erupts in Mexico
title: ‘El Mencho’ killing sparks ‘overwhelming fear’ as violence erupts in Mexico
content: As news of the killing spread, a wave of violence swept across the country. And some fear worse could follow.

originalTitle: Gaza child dies waiting for Israeli permission to leave for treatment
title: Gaza child dies waiting for Israeli permission to leave for treatment
content: Israel continues to block thousands of Palestinians from seeking medical treatment abroad through Rafah crossing.

originalTitle: Four years into its full-scale war in Ukraine, Russia is feeling the effects
title: Four years into its full-scale war in Ukraine, Russia is feeling the effects
content: Steve Rosenberg reports on the economic consequences of Russia's war, and how people are coping.

originalTitle: Zelensky tells BBC Putin has started WW3 and must be stopped
title: Zelensky tells BBC Putin has started WW3 and must be stopped
content: Ukraine's president sat down with the BBC's Jeremy Bowen in Kyiv days before the four-year anniversary of the war.

originalTitle: Cartel henchmen unleash violence after top drug lord killed in Mexico
title: Cartel henchmen unleash violence after top drug lord killed in Mexico
content: The death of the most-wanted Jalisco cartel chief sparks retaliatory violence in at least a dozen states in Mexico.

originalTitle: How ruthless Arsenal exposed Tottenham's weaknesses
title: How ruthless Arsenal exposed Tottenham's weaknesses
content: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains why, as well as Arsenal's superior quality in Sunday's north London derby, they exploited Tottenham's tactical weakness too.

originalTitle: Why Man Utd fans should be glad if Maguire extends stay
title: Why Man Utd fans should be glad if Maguire extends stay
content: Fans should welcome the belief of sources on all sides that Harry Maguire will remain at Manchester United at least for next season, writes Simon Stone.

originalTitle: 'Appalling weekend' - Arokodare & Mundle latest players to be racially abused
title: Football Fun for Everyone!
content:
Hello, hello, my wonderful friends! It's Kiki the Kindness Reporter, coming to you live from beautiful Africa! I love bringing you news, especially about our favourite game: football! It makes us jump, cheer, and sometimes even dance with joy, right? Football is a game where everyone can play. It doesn't matter if you are tall or small, fast or a little slower, or what colour your skin is. We all love to kick the ball and score goals!

Our Amazing Football Heroes

Do you know about two very talented football players? Their names are Tolu Arokodare and Romaine Mundle. Tolu is a striker, which means he is super good at scoring goals for his team called Wolves. Romaine is a winger, and he runs super fast on the side of the field for his team, Sunderland. They play in a big league called the Premier League, where many amazing players from all over the world play! **Did you know?** Football is the most popular game in Africa! Millions of children, just like you, love to play football every single day. We have many, many wonderful football heroes from Africa who play all over the world!

Sometimes, Unkind Words Happen

But sometimes, sad things can happen even in our happy world of football. Recently, Tolu and Romaine received some very unkind messages. These messages were sent to them on something called 'social media'. Social media is like a big talking place on the internet where people share pictures and talk to each other. Imagine someone writing mean things about you, just because of how you look or where your family comes from. That’s what happened to Tolu and Romaine. These words were not fair or kind. They can make even the strongest football players feel very, very sad inside. **Did you know?** Even though football players look strong and brave on the field, they have feelings too! Mean words can make anyone feel hurt, just like when you fall and scrape your knee.

What Are Unkind Words?

Sometimes, people say unkind things about others because they look different or come from a different place. This is not right. Our world is full of so many amazing people, and we all look a little different. Some people have dark skin, some have light skin, some have curly hair, and some have straight hair. These differences make our world beautiful and interesting! When someone says mean things about another person just because of their skin colour or where their family is from, it's very unfair. It's like saying, 'You can't play because you're not like me!' But that's not how football works, and it's not how life should work either. **Did you know?** There are more than 7 billion people in the world! That’s a super big number! And guess what? Not one of them is exactly the same as another. We are all special and unique!

Everyone Is Special and Belongs

Every single person is special, and everyone belongs. Whether you are from Ghana, Nigeria, South Africa, Egypt, or any other wonderful country in Africa or the world, you are important. In football, we see players from so many different countries playing together on the same team. They pass the ball, they cheer for each other, and they work together to win. This is what football teaches us: teamwork, friendship, and respect. It teaches us that we are stronger when we play together and treat everyone with kindness. Imagine a football game where everyone was fighting and saying mean words – that wouldn't be fun at all, would it? It would be a very sad game. **Did you know?** Many football teams have players from five, ten, or even more different countries! They learn to speak different languages and understand each other to play well together. That's true teamwork!

Let's Play Fair and Be Kind!

So, what can we do, my little champions? We can make sure we always play fair and use kind words. When we play football with our friends, let's remember to share the ball, help each other up if someone falls, and always say 'good game' at the end. If you ever hear someone saying unkind words to another person, especially about how they look or where they come from, it's important to speak up. You can tell a trusted grown-up, like your mom, dad, teacher, or an older brother or sister. Grown-ups can help make things right and teach people to be kind. Your words have power! They can make someone smile, or they can make someone sad. Let's choose to use our words to build friendships and make people happy. A kind word is like a warm hug for the heart. **Did you know?** When you are kind to someone, it makes you feel happy too! Kindness is like a special magic that spreads joy to everyone.

Football is About Joy!

Remember, football is about joy, excitement, and making friends. It's about cheering for your team and celebrating amazing goals. It's about running around in the sunshine, feeling the wind in your hair, and having fun with your friends. Let’s keep football a happy place where everyone feels welcome and safe. Let’s learn from our amazing African football heroes who show us how to be strong, talented, and kind, both on and off the field. They inspire us to work hard and to treat everyone with respect.

Our Promise for a Happier Game

So, let’s all promise to be kindness champions! Let’s promise to use our voices to cheer for good things, not to say mean things. Let's promise to treat everyone fairly, no matter what they look like or where they come from. Because when we are kind to each other, football, and indeed our whole world, becomes a much brighter and happier place for everyone. Thank you for listening, my friends! Until next time, keep playing fair, keep being kind, and keep smiling! This is Kiki the Kindness Reporter, signing off!
summary: Two football players received unkind messages online, and it reminds us that everyone is special, belongs, and should always be treated with kindness and fairness.
whyMatters: It matters because everyone deserves to feel happy and safe when they play or watch football, and we must always be kind to each other, no matter how we look or where we come from.
